title: Past Simple Tense
description: Learn to talk about completed actions in the past using the past simple tense.

rules.explanation: Add -ed to the base form of regular verbs. For verbs ending in 'e', just add -d. For verbs ending in consonant + y, change y to i and add -ed.

examples.sentence: I walked to the station yesterday.

rules.explanation: Many common verbs have irregular past forms that must be memorized: go-went, have-had, see-saw, come-came, take-took, make-made, get-got, buy-bought.

examples.sentence: I went to Paris last summer.

rules.explanation: Use 'did not' (didn't) + base form of the verb. Never use -ed with the main verb in negatives.

examples.sentence: I did not (didn't) travel last month.
They didn't stay at a hotel.

rules.explanation: Use 'Did' + subject + base form of the verb. Answer with 'Yes, I did' or 'No, I didn't'.
Common time expressions: yesterday, last week/month/year, ago, in 2020, when I was young. These signal past tense.

examples.sentence: I visited Korea two years ago.
She lived in Japan when she was young.

exercises.question: I _____ to the airport yesterday.
exercises.explanation: 'Go' is an irregular verb. Its past form is 'went'.

exercises.question: We _____ (arrive) at the hotel at midnight.
exercises.explanation: 'Arrive' is regular. Add -d because it ends in 'e'.

exercises.question: They _____ (not/enjoy) the flight.
exercises.explanation: Negative past: didn't + base form. Not 'didn't enjoyed'.

exercises.question: _____ you visit Paris last year?
exercises.explanation: Questions in past simple use 'Did' + subject + base verb.

exercises.question: I didn't _____ the announcement.
exercises.explanation: After 'didn't', use the base form of the verb.

exercises.question: We _____ the museum two days ago.
exercises.explanation: 'Ago' indicates past time. Use past simple: visited.

exercises.question: Put in order: [to, went, I, Japan, last, year]
exercises.explanation: Subject + past verb + to + place + time expression.

exercises.question: The plane _____ (land) safely.
exercises.explanation: 'Land' is regular. Add -ed for past tense.

exercises.question: She _____ me about her trip.
exercises.explanation: 'Tell' is irregular. Past tense is 'told', not 'telled'.

exercises.question: _____ they stay at the beach hotel? (question)
exercises.explanation: Use 'Did' to form past simple questions.

exercises.question: I _____ a taxi to the station.
Put in order: [didn't, We, train, the, miss]
exercises.explanation: Negative: Subject + didn't + base verb + object.
